title: Matt Lucas' touching tribute to partner Kevin McGee ten years on from suicide

Matt Lucas has penned a heartfelt tribute to his boyfriend Kevin McGee, who took his own life ten years ago aged 32.

The comic and actor wrote a lengthy post on Instagram dedicated to Kevin, who he was with for six years.

He posted a touching photo of Kevin smiling on a train platform, and wrote alongside it: "This is Kevin John McGee, who died ten years ago today.

"I loved him more than anyone I’ve ever met, and still do. He was so funny and silly and clever and kind and handsome and his smile made my heart soar.

"We were together for nearly six years and he made me the happiest man on the planet.

"In the end he lost his battle with addiction and depression. I guess some people don’t have the armour for this world. I think of him probably a hundred times a day, every day. In truth, I think of little else."

(Image: FilmMagic)

He concluded: "I would give anything to see him again and maybe one day I will, but for now I will be grateful for the time we had together and the love we shared.

"It was like no other."

Kevin and Matt were married from 2006-2008, and their civil partnership ceremony was attended by famous faces including Barbara Windsor, Elton John and Courtney Love.

(Image: Getty Images)

(Image: realmattlucas/Instagram)

Matt has spoken out before about struggling to deal with his grief.

He told the Sunday Times magazine he sought help from a bereavement counsellor and made the decision not to turn to alcohol, cigarettes or drugs.

"Not turning to drink, which I hardly ever do — I probably have six units a year," he said.

(Image: Rex)

Instead, Matt moved to California and started organising sexual hook-ups on the internet.

"I ended up eating lots and having lots of sex," he said. "That was how I responded.

“As much as anything I was trying to distract myself.”
description: The comedian and actor honoured Kevin with a heartbreaking Instagram post
